subtitle.line: Min yndlingsårstid.
MY FAVOURITE SEASON
Meine liebste Jahreszeit.
MIJN FAVORIETE SEIZOEN
MY FAVOURITE SEASON

line.words: “Oggi voglio che mi parlate della vostra stagione preferita” dice il professore dei bambini, la Signora Adams. “Primavera è in marzo, aprile e maggio. A chi piace la primavera?”

subtitle.line: ”I dag vil jeg gerne have jer til at fortælle mig om jeres yndlingsårstid”, siger børnenes lærer, Mrs Adams. ”Det er forår i marts, april og maj. Hvem kan lide foråret?”
“Today, I want you to tell me about your favourite season,” says the children’s teacher, Mrs Adams. “Spring is in March, April and May. Who likes spring?”
§Heute will ich, dass ihr etwas über eure liebste Jahreszeit erzählt,§ sagt der Lehrer Frau Adams zu den Kindern. §Der Frühling ist im März, April und Mai. Wer mag den Frühling?§
“Vandaag wil ik dat jullie vertellen over jullie favoriete seizoen,” zegt juf Anja. “De lente is in maart, april en mei. Wie houdt er van de lente?”
“Today, I want you to tell me about your favourite season,” says the children’s teacher, Mrs Adams. “Spring is in March, April and May. Who likes spring?”

line.words: “Mi piace la primavera” dice Sunita. “A primavera fa caldo e fa bel tempo. I miei fiori preferiti sono tromboni gialli e fiore di colore rosa. Mi piace anche le gallinelle e gli agnelli.”

subtitle.line: ”Jeg kan godt lide foråret”, siger Sunita. ”Om foråret er det varmt, og solen skinner. Mine yndlingsblomster er gule påskeliljer og rosa blomster. Jeg kan også godt lide kyllinger og lam.”
“I like spring,” says Sunita. “In spring it is warm and sunny. My favourite flowers are yellow daffodils and pink blossom. I also like chicks and lambs.”
§Ich mag den Frühling,§ sagt Sunita. §Im Frühling ist es warm und sonnig. Meine Lieblingsblumen sind gelbe Narzissen und rosa Kirschblüten. Ich mag auch Küken und Lämmer.§
“Ik houd van de lente,” zegt Sonja. “In de lente is het warm en zonnig. Mijn favoriete bloemen zijn gele narcissen en roze bloesem. Ik houd ook van kuikens en lammetjes.”
“I like spring,” says Sunita. “In spring it is warm and sunny. My favourite flowers are yellow daffodils and pink blossom. I also like chicks and lambs.”

line.words: “Anch’io mi piace primavera” dice Peter. “Mi piace Pasqua perchè ho tanti ovetti di cioccolato da mangiare. E il coniglietto di Pasqua è divertente!”

subtitle.line: ”Jeg kan også godt lide foråret”, siger Peter. ”Jeg kan godt lide påske, for så får jeg mange påskeæg, som jeg kan spise. Og påskeharen er sjov”.
“I also like spring,” says Peter. “I like Easter because I have lots of Easter eggs to eat. And the Easter bunny is fun!”
§Ich mag den Frühling auch,§ sagt Peter. §Ich mag Ostern, weil ich viele Ostereier essen kann. Und der Osterhase ist lustig!§
“Ik houd ook van de lente,” zegt Peter. “Ik houd van Pasen omdat ik dan veel paaseieren kan eten. En de Paashaas is leuk!”
“I also like spring,” says Peter. “I like Easter because I have lots of Easter eggs to eat. And the Easter bunny is fun!”

line.words: “Estate è in giugno, luglio e agosto. A chi piace estate?” chiede Signora Adams.

subtitle.line: ”Det er sommer i juni, juli og august. Hvem kan lide sommeren?”, spørger Mrs Adams.
“Summer is in June, July and August. Who likes summer?” asks Mrs Adams.
§Der Sommer ist im Juni, Juli und August. Wer mag den Sommer?§ fragt Frau Adams.
“De zomer is in juni, juli en augustus. Wie houdt er van de zomer?” vraagt juf Anja.
“Summer is in June, July and August. Who likes summer?” asks Mrs Adams.

line.words: “Mi piace estate” dice Maria. “Mi eccito perchè andiamo a trovare mia nonna in Spagna. Fa molto caldo e fa bel tempo. Il cielo è blu e i fiori sono viola.”

subtitle.line: ”Jeg kan godt lide sommeren”, siger Marie. ”Jeg er meget spændt, for vi besøger min bedste i Spanien. Der er det meget varmt, og solen skinner. Himlen er blå, og blomsterne er lilla.”
“I like summer,” says Maria. “I am very excited because we visit my gran in Spain. It is very hot and sunny. The sky is blue and the flowers are purple.”
§Ich mag den Sommer,§ sagt Maria. §Ich bin sehr aufgeregt, weil wir meine Großeltern in Spanien besuchen werden. Es ist sehr heiß und sonnig. Der Himmel ist blau und die Blumen sind lila.§
“Ik houd van de zomer,” zegt Maria. “Wij gaan mijn oma in Spanje bezoeken. Het is heel warm en zonnig. De lucht is blauw en de bloemen zijn paars.”
“I like summer,” says Maria. “I am very excited because we visit my gran in Spain. It is very hot and sunny. The sky is blue and the flowers are purple.”

line.words: “Autunno è in settembre, ottobre e novembre. A chi piace autunno?” chiede Signora Adams.

subtitle.line: ”Det er efterår i september, oktober og november. Hvem kan lide efteråret?”, spørger Mrs Adams.
“Autumn is in September, October and November. Who likes autumn?” asks Mrs Adams.
§Der Herbst ist im September, Oktober und November. Wer mag den Herbst?§, fragt Frau Adams.
“De herfst is in september, oktober en november. Wie houdt er van de herfst?” vraagt Juf Anja.
“Autumn is in September, October and November. Who likes autumn?” asks Mrs Adams.

line.words: “Mi piace autunno” dice Abdul. “Fa abbastanza freddo ed è ventuoso ma ci sono molti colori. Mi piacciono le foglie rosse e gialle.”

subtitle.line: ”Jeg kan godt lide efteråret”, siger Abdul. ”Det er koldt, og det blæser, men der er mange farver. Jeg kan godt lide røde og gule blade”.
“I like autumn,” says Abdul. “It is quite cold and windy, but it is very colourful. I like the red and yellow leaves.”
§Ich mag den Herbst,§ sagt Abdul. §Es ist ganz kalt und windig, aber alles ist so bunt. Ich mag die roten und gelben Blätter.§
“Ik houd van de herfst,” zegt Abdul. “Het is een beetje koud en het waait hard, maar er zijn veel mooie kleuren. Ik houd van de rode en gele bladeren.”
“I like autumn,” says Abdul. “It is quite cold and windy, but it is very colourful. I like the red and yellow leaves.”

line.words: “Inverno è in dicembre, gennaio e febbraio. A chi piace inverno?” chiede Signora Adams.

subtitle.line: ”Det er vinter i december, januar og februar. Hvem kan godt lide vinteren?”, spørger Mrs Adams.
“Winter is in December, January and February. Who likes winter?” asks Mrs Adams.
§Der Winter ist im Dezember, Januar und Februar. Wer mag den Winter?§ fragt Frau Adams.
“De winter is in december, januari en februari. Wie houdt er van de winter?” vraagt Juf Anja.
“Winter is in December, January and February. Who likes winter?” asks Mrs Adams.

line.words: “Mi piace inverno” dice Klara. “Visitiamo mia zia in Polonia. Fa molto freddo ma c’è molta bella neve bianca.

subtitle.line: ”Jeg kan godt lide vinteren”, siger Klara. ”Vi besøger min tante i Polen. Det er meget koldt, men der er en masse smuk, hvid sne.”
“I like winter,” says Klara. “We visit my auntie in Poland. It is very cold but there is lots of beautiful white snow.”
§Ich mag den Winter,§ sagt Klara. §Wir besuchen meine Tante in Polen. Es ist sehr kalt, aber dort gibt es ganz viel schönen weißen Schnee.§
“Ik houd van de winter,” zegt Clara. “We gaan op bezoek bij mijn tante in Polen. Het is erg koud maar er ligt veel mooie witte sneeuw.”
“I like winter,” says Klara. “We visit my auntie in Poland. It is very cold but there is lots of beautiful white snow.”

line.words: “Qual’è la tua stagione preferita, Tom?” chiede Signora Adams.

subtitle.line: ”Hvad er din yndlingsårstid, Tom?”, spørger Mrs Adams.
“What is your favourite season, Tom?” asks Mrs Adams.
§Was ist deine liebste Jahreszeit, Tom?§ fragt Frau Adams.
“Wat is jouw favoriete seizoen, Steven?” vraagt Juf Anja.
“What is your favourite season, Tom?” asks Mrs Adams.

line.words: “Non ne ho” dice Tom. “Faceva bel tempo a primavera ma pioveva molto. Faceva bel tempo l’estate ma non faceva molto caldo. Faceva abbastanza bel tempo in autunno ma era ventuoso.

subtitle.line: ”Jeg har ikke nogen yndlingsårstid”, siger Tom. ”Det var godt vejr i foråret, men det regnede meget. Solen skinnede i sommer, men det var meget varmt. I efteråret var vejret nogenlunde, men det blæste meget.§

“I don’t have a favourite season,” says Steven. “It was good weather in spring, but it was very rainy. It was sunny in summer, but it was very hot. It was quite good weather in autumn, but it was windy.
§Ich habe keine Lieblingsjahreszeit,§ sagt Tom. §Im Frühling war das Wetter schön, aber es hat geregnet. Im Sommer war es sonnig, aber sehr heiß. Im Herbst war das Wetter schön, aber sehr windig.

“Ik heb geen favoriet seizoen,” zegt Steven. “Het was mooi weer in de lente, maar het regende veel. In de zomer was het zonnig, maar het was te warm. Het was best mooi weer in de herfst, maar het waaide hard.

“I don’t have a favourite season,” says Steven. “It was good weather in spring, but it was very rainy. It was sunny in summer, but it was very hot. It was quite good weather in autumn, but it was windy.

line.words: E faceva maltempo in inverno perchè il cielo era grigio e faceva freddissimo.

subtitle.line: Og i vinter var vejret dårligt, fordi himlen var grå, og det var meget koldt.”
And it was bad weather in winter because the sky was grey and it was very cold.”
Im Winter war das Wetter schlecht, weil der Himmel grau war und es war sehr kalt.
En het was slecht weer in de winter, omdat de lucht grijs was en het was heel koud.”
And it was bad weather in winter because the sky was grey and it was very cold.”

line.words: “Spero che ti piacciono gli stagioni l’anno prossimo, Tom!” dice Signora Adams.

subtitle.line: ”Jeg håber, du kan lide årstiderne næste år, Tom”, siger Mrs Adams.
“I hope you like the seasons next year, Tom!” says Mrs Adams.
§Ich hoffe nächstes Jahr magst du die Jahreszeiten, Tom.§ sagt Frau Adams.
“Ik hoop dat je de seizoenen volgend jaar wel fijn vindt, Tom!” zegt juf Anja.
“I hope you like the seasons next year, Tom!” says Mrs Adams.
